name: 4-Aminobenzoic acid
desc: 4-Aminobenzoic acid (also known as para-aminobenzoic acid or PABA because the number 4 carbon in the benzene ring is also known as the para position) is an organic compound with the formula H2NC6H4CO2H. PABA is a white solid, although commercial samples can appear gray. It is slightly soluble in water. It consists of a benzene ring substituted with amino and a carboxyl groups. The compound occurs naturally.
Other names:
para-Aminobenzoic acid
p-Aminobenzoic acid
PABA
Vitamin B10
Vitamin Bx
Bacterial vitamin H1
standard state:
